item.title: Hour 1 : Kyrie's Last Game in NY?
item.description: Stephen A Smith and Kendrick Perkins discusses the Brooklyn Nets issuing Kyrie Irving a 5 game suspension without pay on his failure to issue no clear apology for promoting a book and film containing anti-Semitic rhetoric on his social media. Did the Brooklyn Nets give the proper response to the situation at hand? Can he continue to be the face of an organization without any backlash? Fly Eagles Fly! Marcus Spears and Ryan Clark take a deeper look into the Eagles and try to figure out are they a true threat? Tune in to hear more. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Snyders Selling
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Jay Williams, JJ Redick, and Amar'e Stoudemire discuss the news that Steve Nash is out as Brooklyn's Head Coach and debate how well the situation with Kyrie was handled by the Nets organization. We have Breaking News reaction from Adam Schefter, Marcus Spears, Kimberly A. Martin, and Chris "Mad Dog" Russo as Commanders owner Dan Snyder announces he's exploring a potential sale of the team. Redick and Russo debate whether or not the Nets season can be saved in the wake of Nash's exit and their Kyrie controversy. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Zeke Critique
item.description: In this episode, Jeff Saturday, Keyshawn Johnson, RGIII, and Mina Kimes hold it down for Stephen A. and debate which team is the biggest threat to the Bills and Chiefs in the AFC. Plus, Jeff Saturday takes over the A-List with his top 5 NFL teams this week. With the standout performance by Tony Pollard in the Cowboys' win over the Bears fresh in their minds, the crew debates if he deserves to be the starter over Ezekiel Elliot. Plus, the NFC South is anyone's to win, but which teams do our guys think will come out on top? Aaron Rodgers and the Packers have now lost 4 straight games and we debate if their season is officially finished. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1 : Spooky Season?
item.description: In this episode Dan Orlovsky, Michael "Playmaker" Irvin, and Ryan Clark talks about the issues Aaron Rodgers and the Green Bay Packers are facing as a team. What can they do to rise above and become the successful Green Bay Packers we once knew? Of course Michael "Playmaker" Irvin has to talk about his Cowboys, but what changes at the run game do they need to make to really show how dominate this offense can be? Last but not least, who do you see rising above and clinching the NFC South? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Mac of All Trades
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A. Smith and Bart Scott preview tonight's Ravens-Buccaneers matchup and debate which team will come out on top. Plus, Aaron Rodgers is still calling out his teammates amidst Green Bay's lackluster season, but is he in the right here? Kyrie Irving and the Brooklyn Nets took another L last night against the Bucks, so our guys are asking the question: What should the Nets do with Ben Simmons? Stephen A. and Bart debate whether or not Bill Belichick is making a mistake by naming Mac Jones the starter over Bailey Zappe for their conference matchup against the Jets. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: North Stars
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Dan Orlovsky, and Michael Irvin debate whether or not the Bucs season is over after a Week 7 loss to the Panthers. Another GOAT is trending down as Aaron Rodgers and the Packers also fall to 3-4 after losing to Washington, and our guys debate if they can still fit into the playoff picture. The World Series is set for the Astros and Phillies to battle it out and Jeff Passan is here to preview the matchup and give his take on what went wrong for the Yankees. The crew debates which team is more dangerous this season: the Ravens or the Bengals? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Another GOAT is trending down as Aaron Rodgers and the Packers also fall to 3-4 after losing to Washington, and our guys debate if they can still fit into the playoff picture. The World Series is set for the Astros and Phillies to battle it out and Jeff Passan is here to preview the matchup and give his take on what went wrong for the Yankees. The crew debates which team is more dangerous this season: the Ravens or the Bengals? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Gold Rusher?
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Ryan Clark, and Marcus Spears react to the Panthers trading Christian McCaffrey to the San Francisco 49ers and debate if this move will make them the NFC favorite. Plus, did Kyler Murray and Kliff Kingsbury downplay their heated argument on the sidelines in last night's win? Monica McNutt and Kendrick Perkins join the show to discuss the latest on the Lakers, including if this season is heading towards disaster after an 0-2 start. With Dak Prescott set to return for the Cowboys' Week 7 matchup against the Lions, the crew debates if there's any added pressure on his performance after the success of his backup Cooper Rush. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Favre Under Fire
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Dan Orlovsky, and Damien Woody discuss the primetime matchup between the Eagles and Cowboys and debate who needs to show out the most for their team to get the dub: Hurts or Parsons? Aaron Rodgers and the Packers are coming off of a loss to the Giants and are now facing another New York team, but does the crew think the Jets have it in them to pull of the upset? We react to new comments from Brett Favre denying any wrongdoing in the midst of his involvement in a welfare scandal. Joe Fortenbaugh joins the show with his picks for this week's slate of games that you can take to the bank. Seth Wickersham joins the show with more on the developing story about Commanders owner Dan Snyder digging up dirt on other NFL owners and Commissioner Roger Goodell. Plus, Stephen A. and Dan go head to head in a debate over who poses the biggest threat to the Bills and Chiefs in the AFC. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Snyder Striking Back?
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A. and Dan Orlovsky look ahead to the highly-anticipated rematch between the Bills and Chiefs and debate which star QB will be harder to stop: Mahomes or Allen? Damien Woody stops by to help preview the SNF matchup between the Eagles and Cowboys. The crew debates who needs to step up for the Cowboys the most to hand Philly their first loss of the season. The Giants may be 4-1, but Stephen A. thinks they aren't getting the respect they deserve. And, in a developing story this morning Commanders owner Dan Snyder has reportedly hired investigators to get "dirt" on other executives and claims he can "blow up" several league owners. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Black Hole?
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Keyshawn Johnson, and Mina Kimes debate whether or not the Raiders rocky start is an accurate assessment of their skill level. Plus, Jeff Saturday joins the crew to react to Stephen A.'s Top 5 NFL teams after Week 5. Our crew gives their takes on Commanders Head Coach Ron Rivera saying what he believes is to blame for their lackluster start to the season. Plus, is the path to the Super Bowl more of a challenge in the AFC or NFC? And, do the New England Patriots have a QB controversy on their hands with the sudden success of 3rd string QB Bailey Zappe? item.title: Hour 1: Rush Hour
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Keyshawn Johnson, and Jeff Saturday discuss the Chiefs-Raiders MNF matchup and debate the merits of the controversial playcall by McDaniels to go for (and fail) a 2-pt conversion rather than a game-tying extra point. The Raiders blew a 17-point lead to Kansas City, but do our guys think the Raiders had an epic collapse or the Chiefs mounted an impressive comeback? The crew reacts to another roughing the passer call in last night's game and debates whether or not the officials have gone too far on this one. Plus, Davante Adams was visibly upset after last night's loss and pushed an employee out of his way en route to the locker room. Should he face discipline for his outburst? Cooper Rush is 5-0 as a starter for the Cowboys, but does the crew think he can take Dak's job in Dallas? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Ravens Regret

Plus, did Harbaugh make a grave mistake in going for it on 4th & goal in Baltimore's last second loss to Buffalo? Our guys disagree with each other on this one. Irvin is here to make it known that Cooper Rush is the truth, but Stephen A. still isn't sold on the 4-0 backup QB. And, the crew debates if Green Bay should feel good about their OT win against the Patriots and their 3rd-string quarterback on Sunday. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Fins Up
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Michael Irvin, and Dan Orlovsky react to Jimmy Garoppolo's accidental safety last night and reminisce on a similar incident in 2008. After the Dolphins handed the Bills their first loss of the season, the crew debates if the two teams should be put on the same level. The Packers-Buccaneers game last night saw Rodgers come out on top, but are the guys giving Brady a pass due to the injuries plaguing his team? Stephen A., Irvin, and Orlovsky discuss early concerns for the Chiefs after their week 3 loss. Plus, Lamar Jackson ruined the Patriots home opener with a four-touchdown performance, but is it too early to call him an MVP favorite? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Not Safe for Kirk?
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Chris "Mad Dog" Russo, and Marcus Spears get into how important this Week 3 matchup between the Packers and the Bucs is for Aaron Rodgers. Plus, the Vikings took the L against Philly this week, but is Kirk Cousins the problem in Minnesota? Tim Kurkjian joins the show to help us settle the debate of which homerun storyline deserves more hype: Albert Pujols' chase to 700 or Aaron Judge with 60 this season? Mad Dog is mad 7 days a week, but on Wednesdays he tells us why. Find out who his rage is directed at this week. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: East Mode
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Chris "Mad Dog" Russo, and Marcus Spears debate if the Cowboys can still win the NFC East with Dak on IR for at least 4 games. Plus, what is Mad Dog mad about?? He hashes out all his grudges in a fired up new segment with Stephen A. Broncos coach Nathaniel Hackett admits he was wrong to go for the field goal in the Broncos crushing Week 1 loss to the Seahawks, but is he the only one at fault or is there plenty of blame to go around? Mad Dog gives us his top 5 underdogs to watch in NFL Week 2. The Las Vegas Aces took a 2-0 lead over the Connecticut Sun in the WNBA Finals and are one win away from their first franchise win. But does Stephen A. think they can make it a clean sweep? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Marcus Spears joins the show with his reaction to an incident of racism against a Duke Volleyball player during a match at BYU. Mike Tomlin has never had a losing season... yet. Someone here thinks that streak will end this season. The crew gives us their top Super Bowl sleeper teams.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Tompa Bay
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Michael Irvin, and Dan Orlovsky debate whether or not Tom Brady is capable of winning another Super Bowl in Tampa and if off-the-field issues are factors in his performance. Aaron Rodgers previously called out his young wide receivers but failed to take a single preseason snap with them. The crew argues if that's a red flag in Green Bay. We react to the news of the Bills releasing punter Matt Araiza amid a sexual assault lawsuit. Patrick McEnroe joins the show to preview the first round of the US Open tonight in what could possibly be Serena Williams' final outing. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: New York Win It?
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A., Chris "Mad Dog" Russo, and Brian Windhorst get right into debating what kind of season the Brooklyn Nets will have now that Kevin Durant has agreed to move forward with the team. Plus, Dana White spilled some hot tea that Tom Brady was almost a Raider in 2020, so Stephen A. and Mad Dog debate if this puts more pressure on Derek Carr this season. After the Yankees swept the Mets this week, the crew argues which New York team is the bigger threat when it comes to a World Series push. How about them Cowboys?? Dak Prescott is optimistic about this year's team, but does Kimberly A. Martin share his positive outlook? Stephen A. and the crew get ready to enter Cowboys country as they take the show on the road tomorrow. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.description: In this episode, Stephen A. Smith and Christopher "Mad Dog" Russo debate what will become of the Brooklyn Nets season after Kevin Durant agreed to move forward with the team despite his previous trade demands. Plus, Davante Adams says Aaron Rodgers has "the Michael Jordan Effect", but do our guys agree? Speaking of all-time greats, Nick Saban has 6 national titles as Alabama's head coach. However, he's not who Mad Dog thinks is the G.O.A.T. when it comes to college football coaches. Stephen A. takes us through his #3 NFL storyline this season: How far will Tom Brady and the Bucs go? Kimberly A. Martin joins the debate. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Is it too early to hit the panic button on their season? Lamar Jackson gave the Ravens a Week 1 deadline for contract talks, but how much leverage does he really have? Stephen A. and Irvin decide whether these QBs will "Sink or Swim" this season with Harry Douglas and Keyshawn Johnson reacting in the studio. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Tua Good to be True?
item.description: In this episode, Damien Woody, Emily Kaplan, and Chris Canty react to the Browns' controversial decision to start Deshaun Watson in their preseason opener and debate if the NFL should take any action against it. Serena Williams will say goodbye to tennis after the US Open and the crew discusses what they expect from her final outing. With NFL preseason well underway, Woody, Kaplan, and Canty predict what kind of season is in store for Tua Tagovailoa and debate who is the most important player (not named Dak) on the Cowboy's roster. After Ja'Marr Chase revealed his Top 5 wide receivers in the league, the crew argues which players top their lists. We go back in the archives to relive our favorite moments in sports history. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Sophomore Season
item.description: Ryan Clark, Courtney Cronin, and Chris "Mad Dog" Russo return in this episode to find the perfect fit for free agent Odell Beckham Jr. Could he call Dallas home sweet home? Plus, we debate which 2nd-year quarterback will take the biggest leap this season. Speaking of young guns, the crew has differing opinions on which QB age 25 or under is the best in the game right now. Michael Thomas is participating in Saints training camp drills after missing last season for ankle surgery, so we predict what kind of season the wide receiver will have and if he'll make it back to top-10 WR status. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Repeat After Me
item.description: In this episode, Ryan Clark, Courtney Cronin and Chris "Mad Dog" Russo debate the likelihood of the Rams repeating as Super Bowl Champions and if Nick Chubb and Kareem Hunt are the best RB tandem in the NFL. Why is everyone ganging up on RC? It might have something to do with his choice for the best quarterback in the AFC North. Plus, are the Mets the best team in the National League? We go around the horn with the crew to get their takes on that as well as who they believe has the best offense in the AFC West. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Uncoordinated?
item.description: In this episode, Dan Orlovsky, Katie George, and Domonique Foxworth return to debate Bill Belichick's strategy in failing to name an offensive coordinator ahead of the start of the season. The crew is joined by Jeff Darlington to discuss whether the penalties given to the Dolphins due to their tampering violations were too harsh or not harsh enough. Plus, we predict which NFC East QB will have the better season. We remember and pay tribute to Hall of Fame Dodgers broadcaster Vin Scully after his passing. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Hour 2: Rodge Ball
item.description: Ryan Clark, Fred Taylor, and Harry Douglas return in this episode to debate whether or not the Dallas Cowboys are the best team in the NFC East and if Mike McCarthy is the right guy to lead them. Plus, Aaron Rodgers may have made his case for another Con Air movie, but can he make the case for another MVP title? The crew discusses the impact of Davante Adams' absence on Rodgers' success this season. Tom Brady has another weapon in Tampa as Julio Jones signs a one-year deal with the Bucs, but is it enough to help them repeat as division champs? The guys give us their takes on that plus their reaction to Russell Wilson arriving at training camp repping a...Russell Wilson jersey? With the opening of the Jackie Robinson Museum in NYC, Ryan, Fred, and Harry talk about how his legacy has impacted their lives. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Mike'd Up
item.description: In this episode, Harry Douglas, Ryan Clark, and Fred Taylor debate what Mike McCarthy needs to do in order to have some job security in Dallas and if he's the right guy for the job. After Kyler Murray's contract extension made headlines with a mandatory film study clause, the crew questions if he made the right decision to stay in Arizona. Another day, another anonymous defensive play caller shading a star NFL quarterback. Harry, Ryan, and Fred react to criticism of Patrick Mahomes being a tier 2 QB. Ole Miss Head Coach Lane Kiffin joins the show with his hot take on the impact of NIL deals on college sports and more reaction to his viral tiktok moment. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Hour 2: Expect the Unexpected
item.description: In this episode, Ryan Clark, Channing Crowder, and Domonique Foxworth return to debate if Kyler Murray is under more pressure this season after it was revealed he has mandatory film study in his contract extension. The crew tries to expect the unexpected and predict what team they believe will emerge as a sleeper this NFL season. Ryan, Channing, and Domonique discuss just how worried Mike McCarthy should be about his job security as head coach of "America's Team". Plus, Aaron Rodgers in a Con Air sequel...? item.title: Hour 1: House of Cards
item.description: In this episode, Ryan Clark, Channing Crowder, and Domonique Foxworth react to Kyler Murray's massive contract extension with the Cardinals that includes a certain clause requiring him to do his homework. After an anonymous defensive coordinator labeled Lamar Jackson a second-tier quarterback, the crew decides if the comments were fair or foul. Plus, Ryan, Channing, and Domonique debate the future of the Kansas City Chiefs after Tyreek Hill's move to Miami. Bill Belichick and the Patriots still haven't named key positions of their coaching staff, which begs the question: Is this another one of Bill's tricks or is New England in trouble? Our guys have the answer. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Down Hill?
item.description: In this episode, Courtney Cronin, Bart Scott, and Chris "Mad Dog" Russo return to discuss the state of the Kansas City Chiefs after Tyreek Hill was dealt to Miami this offseason. Speaking of Hill, he joins the show to give us some insight into his decision to leave Patrick Mahomes and why he's looking forward to working with Tua Tagovailoa. David Ortiz has officially been inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame, but what does this mean for Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens? Courtney and our own hall of famer Chris Russo go head to head in a Hall of Fame debate. Plus, which QB will have a bigger Sophomore year? The crew talks about what they expect for the futures of Trey Lance, Zach Wilson, Trevor Lawrence and more. Unsurprisingly, Draymond Green is giving hot takes on Twitter and taking shots at the 1998 Chicago Bulls. Very surprisingly, Mad Dog agrees with him! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Knocking on Kevin's Door
item.description: In this episode, Courtney Cronin, Bart Scott and Chris "Mad Dog" Russo react to the news of the Boston Celtics being among the teams in trade talks for Kevin Durant. Mark Jackson joins the show with his take on the Durant decision and if he believes Russell Westbrook can salvage his career in Los Angeles. And, as Davante Adams reports to Raiders training camp, Courtney, Bart, and Mad Dog debate whether he's better off with Derek Carr or if he'll miss his QB connection with Aaron Rodgers. Plus, Bill Belichick still hasn't named his coaching staff with the season fast approaching and the crew decides if he's on the verge of a Patriots dictatorship. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Madden Madness
item.description: Robert Williams III and Bart Scott return in this episode to debate if a (much wealthier) Kyler Murray can lead the Cardinals to a Super Bowl this season after agreeing to a massive contract extension with Arizona. Rece Davis joins the show to help count us down to college football season with his take on the possibility of Georgia repeating as national champions and what team he believes could be a dark horse to make the playoffs. On the final day of Madden ratings reveal week, Kimberly A. Martin is back to debate who is the better QB right now: Brady or Rodgers? Also, the crew decides if it's a big deal for Bill Belichick and the Patriots to go without an offensive coordinator this season. Bart predicted the future last year with the Rams Super Bowl title, will he do it again with his pick to win the NFC? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Stars Realigning
item.description: Chris Russo, Dan Orlovsky, and Paul Finebaum discuss which school should the SEC target if they are looking for a conference expansion. The guys debate whether Texas and Oklahoma joining the SEC is bigger than USC and UCLA joining the Big Ten. item.title: Hour 1: Lake Show
item.description: In this episode, Domonique Foxworth, Chris "Mad Dog" Russo, and Brian Windhorst discuss the news of the Phoenix Suns matching the Pacers' offer to Deandre Ayton and how it impacts trade scenarios for Donovan Mitchell and Kevin Durant. Also debated is whether or not the Lakers are expected to improve this year after missing last year's playoffs and which player gets the most unfair criticism. And, as Tom Brady's 45th birthday approaches, the crew discusses how much longer they'd like to see The GOAT play. Karl Ravech joins the show to talk Home Run Derby stand-outs and teams in World Series contention. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Tom vs. Time vs. Aaron Rodgers?
item.description: Domonique Foxworth and Chris "Mad Dog" Russo return to share their takes on if Donovan Mitchell would be the biggest sports star in The Big Apple if Utah deals him to the Knicks. Plus, it's all eyes on Tiger in Round 2 of The Open Championship and the guys make their predictions on whether or not he'll make the cut. As Tom Brady's 45th birthday looms, the crew debates how long he'll keep playing and the chances that Aaron Rodgers will call it a career before him. Also, in the wake of Lamar Jackson's recent Twitter clapbacks, Domonique and Mad Dog argue if he's the most unfairly criticized athlete in sports today. Brian Windhorst is back to talk about the NBA's load management issue. Mad Dog gives us his all-time top 5 NFL uniforms, but does he have them right? And, the crew decides which event is more exciting: the Home Run Derby or the Slam Dunk Contest. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: All That Jazz
item.description: In this episode, Domonique Foxworth, Courtney Cronin, and Keyshawn Johnson try to answer Windy's viral question "What's going on in Utah?" as they debate the best trade scenarios and landing spots for Donovan Mitchell. Also discussed is Kevin Durant's trade request from the Brooklyn Nets and how much leverage he has (or doesn't have) to force a trade. Domonique, Courtney, and Keyshawn also debate the impact Tyreek Hill's departure will have on the Chiefs in the AFC. The crew reacts to some Twitter beef between the Lamar Jackson and Bernard Pollard. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: Gimme Jimmy
item.description: In this episode, Domonique Foxworth, Courtney Cronin, and Keyshawn Johnson are back to debate who should get the 49ers starting QB gig: Jimmy Garoppolo or Trey Lance? The crew also discusses what NBA teams should watch out for when trading for Kevin Durant. Later in the episode, Courtney, Domonique, and Keyshawn give their takes on whether or not the NBA should incentivize players to play in more of the 82 regular season games. Vince Young joins the show to look back on his performance in the 2006 Rose Bowl against Keyshawn's USC Trojans and offers his perspective on the Longhorns' decision to join the SEC. Also, does Vince think No. 1 recruit Arch Manning will have a big impact on Texas? Plus, why did Courtney walk the full length of the Brooklyn Bridge? Kevin Durant knows the answer. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Legend of Luka
item.description: In this episode, Courtney Cronin, Domonique Foxworth, and Kendrick Perkins debate Kevin Durant's possible landing spots across the league in the wake of his request to be traded from the Brooklyn Nets. Plus, with Golden State seemingly in the mix, the crew decides what would happen to his legacy if KD returned to the Warriors. Courtney, Domonique, and Perk also tackle the question of whether or not Luka Doncic will bring Dallas any titles after his declaration of loyalty to the Mavericks organization. Also covered in this episode; how do we feel about the NBA play-in tournament? Opinions fly as the crew decides if they're in or out on making the play-in tournament a permanent fixture of the NBA season. Later, Louis Riddick joins the show to debate which AFC West quarterback has the most at stake this season. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Kevin Sent
item.description: In this episode, Freddie Coleman, Courtney Cronin, and Brian Windhorst react to Kevin Durant's request for a trade from the Brooklyn Nets; debating his best landing spots around the league and where this leaves Kyrie Irving. After the addition of Jalen Brunson to the New York Knicks, the crew answers the burning question: Are the Knicks a playoff team? Also, Paul Finebaum joins the show to discuss what the college football landscape will look like as USC and UCLA make the move from the PAC-12 to the Big Ten in 2024 and what it means for The Fighting Irish. Staying in the NBA's Eastern Conference, the crew is joined by Freddie Coleman to discuss which team is the biggest dark horse heading into the season. Also, Chris, Brian, and Freddie ask the question: Should Lebron want an extension with the Lakers? Booger McFarland joins the show to debate if the Eagles are an All-Star team and if the Dallas Cowboys will win a playoff game this season. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Hour 2: Best in the NFL
item.description: In this episode, Stephen A. has a bone to pick with Chris "Mad Dog" Russo. Freddie Coleman and Brian Windhorst return to discuss which team has more questions than answers: the Brooklyn Nets or the Philadelphia 76ers? Courtney Cronin joins the debate with her take on if Shohei Ohtani or Aaron Judge will be the most entertaining player in this season's home run race. The crew also discusses how many titles are in the future for this Golden State Warriors team. Booger McFarland joins in the fun as they debate which team in the NFL has the best roster going into this season and if the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' success is determined by another Super Bowl title. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Deshaun Watson Latest
item.description: Stephen A. Smith, Chris Russo, and Robert Griffin III react to 20 of the 24 lawsuits filed against Deshaun Watson being settled. The guys discuss Rob Gronkowski retiring, what would Tom Brady be without him, and much more. JJ Redick stops by to debate if the Knicks should be interested in Kyrie Irving. item.title: Hour 2: Flash Point
item.description: Marcus Spears and JJ Redick discuss which situation is the best for Kyrie Irving to succeed. Plus they debate whether Kevin Durant needs to add another ring for his legacy. The crew also reacts to comments Draymond Green made about the new wave of athlete media. Later Robert Griffin III joins the show to discuss whether the Cowboys will be better or worse this season. Finally breaking news, the crew reacts to Deshaun Watson settling 20 of his 24 civil lawsuits. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
